popular.name: Samosas
popular.subtitle: Crispy fried pastries with a savory filling.
popular.description: Samosas are a popular appetizer, featuring a golden-brown, crispy pastry filled with a spiced mixture of potatoes, peas, and sometimes minced meat.
method: Prepare the dough by mixing flour, oil, salt, and water until it forms a smooth dough. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
For the filling, heat a pan and add cumin seeds. Once aromatic, add mashed potatoes, peas, garam masala, chili powder, and salt. Mix well and let cool.
Divide the dough into small balls, roll them out, and cut into halves to form semicircles.
Shape each semicircle into a cone, fill it with the potato mixture, and seal the edges with water.
Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry the samosas until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

popular.name: Falooda
popular.subtitle: A sweet and refreshing dessert drink.
popular.description: Falooda is a traditional South Asian dessert drink made with milk, rose syrup, vermicelli, basil seeds, and often topped with ice cream.
method: Soak basil seeds in water for 15 minutes until they swell.
Cook vermicelli as per package instructions and cool it down.
In a glass, layer rose syrup, cooked vermicelli, and basil seeds.
Pour chilled milk over the layers and stir gently.
Top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and garnish with nuts if desired.
Serve immediately.

popular.name: Chicken Biryani
popular.subtitle: Aromatic spiced rice with marinated chicken.
popular.description: Chicken Biryani is a flavorful and aromatic dish combining tender marinated chicken with spiced basmati rice.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cilantro and mint leaves, chopped
method: Wash and soak the basmati rice for 30 minutes.
Marinate the chicken with yogurt, biryani masala, turmeric, ginger-garlic paste, and salt. Let it rest for 1 hour.
In a large pot, heat ghee and fry onions until golden brown. Remove half the onions for garnish.
Add tomatoes, marinated chicken, and cook until the chicken is tender.
In a separate pot, boil water with salt and cook the rice until 70% done. Drain and set aside.
Layer the pot with half the rice, then the chicken, followed by the remaining rice.
Sprinkle cilantro, mint leaves, and fried onions. Cover tightly and cook on low heat (dum) for 20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita or salad.

popular.name: Chicken Karahi
popular.subtitle: Spicy Meat Cooked in a Wok
popular.description: Karahi is a famous Pakistani dish made with tender meat, cooked in a wok-like pan (karahi) with tomatoes, green chilies, and aromatic spices.
method: Heat oil in a karahi or deep pan. Add cumin seeds and fry for a few seconds.
Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes, green chilies, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt.
Cook for 15-20 minutes until the meat is cooked and tender.
Add garam masala and stir well.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

popular.name: Lassi
popular.subtitle: A traditional yogurt-based drink
popular.description: Lassi is a popular drink in South Asia, made from yogurt and available in sweet or salty varieties. It's a perfect summer cooler.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sugar or salt (for sweet or salty lassi)
1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom (optional, for sweet lassi)
method: Blend yogurt, water/milk, sugar or salt, and optional cardamom in a blender until smooth and frothy.
Pour the mixture into a glass over ice cubes.
Garnish with a sprinkle of cardamom or a sprig of mint if desired.
Serve chilled.

popular.name: Haleem
popular.subtitle: A Savory and Hearty Stew
popular.description: Haleem is a slow-cooked stew made with wheat, barley, lentils, and meat (usually chicken or beef). It’s a rich and creamy dish that is popular during Ramadan and other festive occasions.
ingredients: 500g chicken or beef, cut into pieces
Fresh coriander and mint for garnish
method: Wash and soak the wheat, barley, and lentils for a few hours.
In a large pot, cook chicken or beef with ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder until the meat is tender.
Add the soaked wheat, barley, and lentils to the pot, and cook for 2-3 hours on low heat, stirring frequently to avoid burning.
Once the mixture has thickened and the meat is fully cooked, blend the stew using a hand blender or food processor to achieve a smooth consistency.
Add garam masala and salt, and cook for another 10 minutes.
Heat ghee in a separate pan and fry onions until golden brown. Add this to the haleem.
Garnish with fresh coriander, mint, and fried onions before serving.

popular.name: Aloo Paratha
popular.subtitle: Stuffed Flatbread with Spiced Potatoes
popular.description: Aloo Paratha is a traditional Indian flatbread stuffed with spiced mashed potatoes. It's served with yogurt, pickle, or a dollop of butter.
method: Mix flour and salt in a bowl. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Cover and set aside.
In a separate bowl, mix mashed potatoes with cumin seeds, garam masala, chili powder, ground coriander, and salt.
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Roll out each portion into a small circle, place a spoonful of the potato mixture in the center, and seal the dough around it.
Roll out the stuffed dough ball into a flat, round paratha.
Heat a tawa or skillet over medium heat, add ghee or butter, and cook each paratha until golden brown on both sides, brushing with more ghee if necessary.
Serve with yogurt or pickle.

popular.name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
popular.subtitle: Tangy and flavorful chicken with pineapple and bell peppers.
popular.description: A vibrant and tangy dish with crispy chicken coated in a sweet and sour sauce, paired with vegetables and pineapple.
method: Combine cornstarch and flour in a bowl, coat chicken pieces, and fry until golden and crispy.
In a saucepan, mix ketchup, sugar, vinegar, and soy sauce. Heat until thickened.
In a wok, stir-fry bell peppers and pineapple for 2 minutes.
Add the crispy chicken to the wok and pour the sauce over it. Toss well.
Cook for another minute and serve hot.

popular.name: Seekh Kebabs
popular.subtitle: Minced Meat Kebabs Grilled on Skewers
popular.description: Seekh Kebabs are spiced minced meat, usually beef or chicken, formed onto skewers and grilled to perfection. They are a popular appetizer or main course in Pakistani cuisine.
method: In a large bowl, mix the minced meat with all the ingredients, including onions, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, and spices.
Knead the mixture well until it becomes smooth and holds together.
Divide the mixture into small portions and shape them around skewers.
Heat oil in a grill pan or outdoor grill and cook the kebabs for 10-15 minutes, turning them until they are cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot with naan or rice, and garnish with fresh coriander.

popular.name: Hot and Sour Soup
popular.subtitle: A tangy and spicy soup with tofu and mushrooms.
popular.description: A warming and flavorful soup that combines tangy and spicy elements, ideal for cold weather.
method: In a pot, bring broth to a boil and add soy sauce, vinegar, and chili paste.
Add tofu and mushrooms, simmering for 5 minutes.
Slowly pour the beaten egg into the soup while stirring to create egg ribbons.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture and cook until the soup thickens.
Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

popular.name: Chapli Kebab
popular.subtitle: Spiced Minced Meat Patties
popular.description: Chapli Kebab is a popular dish in Pakistan made with minced meat (usually beef or mutton) and a mixture of spices. It is shaped into round patties and fried until crispy.
method: In a large bowl, combine the minced meat with onion, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, coriander seeds, cumin powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala.
Add chopped coriander, pomegranate seeds, egg, and cornflour. Mix well and knead the mixture until smooth.
Shape the mixture into round patties.
Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the patties until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot with naan or rice, and garnish with fresh coriander.

popular.name: Spring Rolls
popular.subtitle: Crispy rolls filled with vegetables or meat
popular.description: Spring rolls are a crispy and delightful appetizer filled with a variety of vegetables or halal meat, served with dipping sauce.
method: Prepare the filling by stir-frying cabbage, carrots, chicken, soy sauce, black pepper, and ginger-garlic paste. Let it cool.
Place the filling on a spring roll wrapper, roll tightly, and seal the edges with water.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the spring rolls until golden brown.
Serve hot with sweet chili sauce.

popular.name: Karak Chai
popular.subtitle: A spiced tea with condensed milk
popular.description: Karak chai is a strong, flavorful tea made with spices and sweetened condensed milk. It's popular in the Middle East.
method: In a saucepan, bring water, tea leaves, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick to a boil.
Simmer for 5 minutes to let the flavors infuse.
Strain the tea into a cup.
Add condensed milk and stir until well combined.
Serve hot.

popular.name: Chicken Korma
popular.subtitle: Rich and Creamy Meat Curry
popular.description: Korma is a rich and creamy curry made with meat (chicken or beef), yogurt, and a blend of aromatic spices, often served on special occasions in Pakistan.
method: Heat ghee or oil in a large pot. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add yogurt and cook for another 10 minutes until the oil separates.
Add garam masala and stir well.
Add cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

popular.name: Pakoras
popular.subtitle: Spiced vegetable or chicken fritters
popular.description: Pakoras are crispy, golden fritters made with vegetables or chicken coated in a spiced chickpea flour batter, deep-fried to perfection.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., onions, spinach, potatoes)
method: In a bowl, mix chickpea flour, water, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, and salt to form a thick batter.
Add vegetables to the batter and mix until well coated.
Heat oil in a pan and drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown, turning occasionally. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with chutney.

popular.name: Gulab Jamun
popular.subtitle: Sweet Fried Dough Balls in Syrup
popular.description: Gulab Jamun is a popular dessert made from deep-fried dough balls soaked in rose-scented sugar syrup. It’s a classic sweet treat enjoyed during festivals and special occasions.
method: In a mixing bowl, combine milk powder, flour, and baking soda.
2Add melted ghee and mix. Gradually add milk to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls, ensuring they are smooth and crack-free.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the dough balls on low heat until golden brown.
In another pan, prepare the sugar syrup by boiling sugar, water, and cardamom. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add rose water to the syrup and stir.
Once the dough balls are fried, soak them in the sugar syrup for 20-30 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

popular.name: Dal Tarka
popular.subtitle: Lentils with Tempered Spices
popular.description: Dal Tarka is a flavorful and comforting dish made with lentils cooked with spices, and then topped with a tempering of fried garlic, cumin, and other aromatic spices. It’s a common dish in Pakistani households, served with rice or roti.
ingredients: 1 cup yellow lentils (moong dal or toor dal)
method: Rinse the lentils and cook them in a pot with enough water until tender and cooked through.
In a separate pan, heat oil or ghee. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes soften.
Add the cooked lentils to the pan and mix well.
In a small pan, heat ghee or oil for tempering. Add asafoetida, dried red chilies, and cumin seeds, frying them for a minute.
Pour the tempering over the dal and garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

popular.name: Fruit Salad
popular.subtitle: A refreshing mix of seasonal fruits.
popular.description: Fruit salad is a simple and refreshing dish made with a variety of fresh fruits, often served with honey or yogurt.
method: Chop all fruits into bite-sized pieces.
Mix in a bowl and drizzle with honey and lemon juice.
Serve chilled.

popular.name: Chocolate Cake
popular.subtitle: A rich and moist chocolate cake.
popular.description: Chocolate Cake is a classic dessert that is moist, rich, and full of chocolate flavor.
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Mix dry ingredients together.
Whisk eggs, milk, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Pour into a greased cake pan and bake for 35 minutes.
Let cool before serving.

popular.name: Chicken Fried Rice
popular.subtitle: Savory rice stir-fried with chicken and veggies
popular.description: Chicken Fried Rice is a quick and satisfying dish made by stir-frying cooked rice with tender chicken pieces, vegetables, soy sauce, and scrambled eggs. It’s a staple in many Chinese restaurants and a great way to use leftover rice. Perfect as a main meal, it’s packed with umami flavors and loved by both kids and adults.
method: Heat oil in a wok. Scramble eggs and set aside.
Add more oil and cook chicken until done. Set aside.
Stir-fry vegetables for 2–3 minutes.
Add rice and stir well to break up clumps.
Add cooked chicken and eggs back to the pan.
Season with soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Top with green onions before serving.

popular.name: Fish and Chips
popular.subtitle: Crispy battered fish served with golden fries
popular.description: Fish and Chips is a classic British dish featuring white fish (usually cod or haddock) dipped in a seasoned batter, deep-fried until golden, and served with thick-cut fries. It’s commonly accompanied by tartar sauce and lemon wedges. A crispy, flaky, and satisfying meal perfect for lunch or dinner.
ingredients: Tartar sauce and lemon wedges for serving
method: Peel and cut potatoes. Soak in water for 10 minutes, then dry and fry until golden.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, and sparkling water to make batter.
Coat fish fillets in batter. Deep-fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels. Serve with fries, lemon wedges, and tartar sauce.

popular.name: Hyderabadi Dum Biryani
popular.subtitle: Authentic layered biryani cooked on dum
popular.description: Hyderabadi Dum Biryani is a famous South Indian rice dish made with marinated meat, basmati rice, saffron, and whole spices, layered and cooked together using the dum method. The aroma, richness, and bold flavors make it one of the most iconic biryanis in the world.
ingredients: Saffron soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk
method: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, fried onions, mint, and coriander. Let it sit for 2 hours.
Cook basmati rice till 70% done. Drain and keep aside.
Layer marinated chicken in a heavy pot. Top with rice, saffron milk, and ghee.
Seal the pot with dough and cook on low heat for 45 minutes.
Serve hot with raita or salan.

popular.name: Sindhi Biryani
popular.subtitle: Spicy and tangy biryani from Sindh
popular.description: Sindhi Biryani is known for its spiciness, tangy flavor, and the use of dried plums, potatoes, and tomatoes along with aromatic rice and meat. It's a festive and flavorful biryani from the Sindh region of Pakistan.
method: Fry onions until golden, add tomatoes, spices, and yogurt. Cook until oil separates.
Add meat and cook until tender. Add potatoes and plums.
Parboil rice and layer over meat. Top with mint, green chilies, and fried onions.
Steam cook (dum) for 20–25 minutes. Serve hot.

popular.name: Chicken Corn Soup
popular.subtitle: Comforting Asian-style chicken corn soup
popular.description: This Pakistani-style Chicken Corn Soup is rich, slightly thickened, and flavored with shredded chicken, sweet corn, and beaten egg. It's a popular winter favorite and is often served with soy sauce, vinegar, and chili sauce on the side.
method: Bring chicken broth to a boil.
Add shredded chicken and corn. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add cornflour slurry and stir until thickened slightly.
Slowly add beaten egg while stirring to form ribbons.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with spring onions.
Serve hot with condiments like soy sauce and vinegar.

popular.name: Cold Coffee
popular.subtitle: Chilled and frothy coffee delight
popular.description: Cold Coffee is a creamy and refreshing iced coffee beverage made with instant coffee, milk, sugar, and ice. It's perfect for coffee lovers looking for a cool treat.
ingredients: 2 scoops vanilla or coffee ice cream (optional)
method: Dissolve coffee and sugar in water.
Add milk and ice cubes. Blend until frothy.
Pour into glasses and optionally top with ice cream.

popular.name: Chicken Zinger Burger
popular.subtitle: Crispy spicy chicken filet burger
popular.description: The Chicken Zinger Burger features a crispy, spicy fried chicken filet layered with fresh lettuce and mayonnaise in a sesame seed bun. It’s crunchy, flavorful, and a fan favorite of fast food lovers.
method: Marinate chicken in spices for 30 mins.
Dip chicken in egg, then coat in flour + cornstarch mixture.
Deep fry until golden and cooked through.
Toast the bun and assemble with lettuce, mayo, and chicken.
Serve hot.
